intro: Papaver somniferum, commonly known as the opium poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It produces striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to red, and its蒴果 (capsule) contains the latex from which opium is derived. The plant has been cultivated for thousands of years for its medicinal and narcotic properties. Its botanical features include alternate, ovate leaves and a robust root system. Due to its psychoactive compounds, it is tightly regulated in many countries.
